intro: Fleischmannia remotifolia, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, often pink or purple flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions with a deep root system and minimal water requirements. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, making it an important species in desert ecosystems.
